instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2530: What is 820-2530? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U5000: What is U5000? This is the System Management Controller(SMC) in macbooks from 2013-2015.
definitions.PPVCORE_S0_CPU: What is PPVCORE_S0_CPU? This is the primary power rail for the CPU that powers the CPU, known as CPU vcore. Without this, the machine will be braindead. .
definitions.ALL_SYS_PWRGD: What is ALL_SYS_PWRGD? ALL_SYS_PWRGD is present when PP1V8_S3, PP5V_S3, PP1V2_S3, PP1V05_S0, PP5V_S0, PP3V3_S0, & PP1V5_S0 are present and working. If any of these rails is not working, ALL_SYS_PWRGD will be pulled down and the machine will not turn on. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2530</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no display
threads.message:
Im a new repair tech and i am getting experience on older boards, wondering if anyone can help me out. 

I have fan spin and green light but no display, i have back light voltage, and i checked the screen with a flashlight and there was no image

i cleaned corrosion around  G4300, G9440, and L7320.

i replaced <CHIP>U5000</CHIP> as it was not giving 3.4v on pin 2

i tested <CAPACITOR>C7565</CAPACITOR> and was getting 1v for <SIGNAL>PPVCORE_S0_MCP</SIGNAL>, and i also tested l7400 and got 0v for <SIGNAL>PPVCORE_S0_CPU</SIGNAL>

thanks for reading
-Robert

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2530</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no display
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2530</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no display
threads.message:
"G4300, G9440"
I don't see these on schematic...

Do you get correct voltages at L7320, L7620, L7760?
3V at <SIGNAL>ALL_SYS_PWRGD</SIGNAL>?

"i have back light voltage, and i checked the screen with a flashlight and there was no image"
Something strange there.
Why should you need flashlight if has backlight???
Please explain correctly the symptomps.

However, no CPU VCORE, so board cannot work at all; no backlight/image, nor USB activity.
